conclusion: Plan to solve step-by-step to find static friction force on block D during acceleration

Four identical blocks (A, B, C, D) on a smooth horizontal surface; Blocks B and C connected by a light spring; Horizontal pulling force F applied to block B; All blocks accelerate together with the same acceleration
In the second image, F = 4ma; In the third image, forces f = ma acting between blocks
All blocks have the same mass m and acceleration a; External force F = 4ma; Blocks must be in contact since they move together
Analyze forces on block B: Pulling force F = 4ma to the right, spring force to the left, contact force from block A to the left
Analyze forces on block A: Contact force from block B to the right, no other horizontal forces
Analyze forces on block C: Spring force to the right, contact force from block D to the left
Analyze forces on block D: Contact force from block C to the right, no other explicit horizontal forces, but there must be static friction
For block D to accelerate with acceleration a, net force of ma must act on it from contact with block C, so static friction force on block D is f = ma
Verify force transmission: Total external force F = 4ma accounts for accelerating all blocks; Block A, B, C, D each require ma, totaling 4ma
The magnitude of the static friction force acting on block D during the acceleration process is ma
